Project Gutenberg, founded in 1971, is the oldest producer and distributor of free ebooks.

According to Michael Hart (March 8, 1947 – September 6, 2011), founder of Project Gutenberg, the mission of Project Gutenberg is simple: to encourage the creation and distribution of eBooks.
This mission is, as much as possible, to encourage all those who are interested in making eBooks and helping to give them away.

note: Congressman for #NY16. Life long educator. Former middle school principal. Causing good trouble. Fighting for jobs and education, not bombs and incarceration.

I know I'm supposed to be civil, but I make no promises if I interact with any fascists, white supremacists, or other far-right savages. Expect me to say a lot about politics.

I'm anticapitalist, but not crazy about Marx's solution.

I'm Japanese, Norwegian, and Swedish. I like cooking and nerd stuff.
